sorcer.service

Class Accessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • sorcer.service.Accessor

  • public class Accessor
extends java.lang.Object
    A service accessing facility that allows to find dynamically a network service provider matching its Signature. This class uses the Factory Method pattern with the DynamicAccessor interface.
    Author:
    Mike Sobolewski, Dennis Reedy

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Accessor()

    • Constructor Detail

      • Accessor

        public Accessor()

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static DynamicAccessor create(Configuration config)
        Create an instance of a DynamicAccessor if one has not been created.
        Parameters:
        config - The Configuration object to use to create the DynamicAccessor. The sorcer.env provider.lookup.accessor configuration entry will be used to create the DynamicAccessor.
        Returns:
        An instance of DynamicAccessor.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - If there are issues using the configuration.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the configuration arg is null.

      • get

        public static DynamicAccessor get()
        Get the created DynamicAccessor instance.
        Returns:
        An instance of DynamicAccessor.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the DynamicAccessor instance has not been created by this utility.

      • create

        public static DynamicAccessor create()
        Create an instance of a DynamicAccessor if one has not been created.
        Returns:
        An instance of DynamicAccessor created with no configuration. This method should be used with care, as underlying discovery management cannot be configured.

      • isAlive

        public static boolean isAlive(Provider provider)
        Test if provider is still replying.
        Parameters:
        provider - the provider to check
        Returns:
        true if a provider is alive, otherwise false
